snippet: As a stretch of America lies ruined, Washington watchdogs complain about parts of the rescue package they once welcomed in their districts.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column scores members of Congress trying to gut federal relief package for Hurricane Sandy victims in New York and New Jersey; recounts some of the more heartbreaking stories from disaster, and says there are fewer sights less edifying than self-satisfied men giving themselves fiscal conservative rub-down as stretch of America lies ruined.
lead_paragraph: As a stretch of America lies ruined, Washington watchdogs complain about parts of the rescue package they once welcomed in their districts.

headline.seo: Changing Tone on Disaster Relief Costs When It’s Closer to Home
headline.main: Discussing Disaster Relief Costs, and Changing Tone When It’s Closer to Home
headline.print_headline: Discussing Disaster Relief Costs, and Changing Tone When It’s Closer to Home
